net.sf.mmm.util.contenttype.base.format

Class SegmentContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.contenttype.base.format.Segment
      • net.sf.mmm.util.contenttype.base.format.SegmentContainer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SegmentContainerChoice, SegmentContainerSequence

    public abstract class SegmentContainer
extends Segment
    A SegmentContainer is like a list of Segments. As it is also a Segment itself a SegmentContainer can contain other SegmentContainers. This class is abstract - see the available subclasses for additional information.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • aggregateMinimumLength

        protected long aggregateMinimumLength(long aggregated,
                                      long next)
        This method aggregates the current aggregated minimum length with the given next value. The default implementation is a simple summation.
        Parameters:
        aggregated - is the current aggregated result, initially getMinimumLength() of the first child.
        next - is the next length to aggregate.
        Returns:
        the new aggregated result.

      • getMaximumLength

        public long getMaximumLength()
        Description copied from class: Segment
        This method gets the maximum length of this Segment. Simple Segments like SegmentConstant have a fixed length. In this case the result of this method is the same as Segment.getMinimumLength(). Otherwise, the Segment is variable and this method returns a value greater than Segment.getMinimumLength(). Use Long.MAX_VALUE for an unbound segment like SegmentAny.
        Overrides:
        getMaximumLength in class Segment
        Returns:
        the maximum length.

      • aggregateMaximumLength

        protected long aggregateMaximumLength(long aggregated,
                                      long next)
        This method aggregates the current aggregated maximum length with the given next value. The default implementation is a simple summation.
        ATTENTION:
        Please note that Long.MAX_VALUE is already handled by getMaximumLength(). In that case this method is NOT invoked anymore.
        Parameters:
        aggregated - is the current aggregated result, initially getMaximumLength() of the first child.
        next - is the next length to aggregate.
        Returns:
        the new aggregated result.

      • doValidate

        protected void doValidate(StringBuilder source)
        Description copied from class: Segment
        This method validates this segment recursively to ensure the correctness of the configured format.
        Overrides:
        doValidate in class Segment
        Parameters:
        source - describes the source of the validation.

      • validateNonRecursive

        protected void validateNonRecursive(StringBuilder source)
        Description copied from class: Segment
        This method validates this segment to ensure the correctness of the configured format.
        ATTENTION:
        This method does NOT perform a recursive validation of potential sub-segments.
        Overrides:
        validateNonRecursive in class Segment
        Parameters:
        source - describes the source of the validation.
